definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You're looking at a guy who could very well get stood up by a stray cat tonight.
sentences.chinese: 在你面前是一位今晚很可能被流浪貓放鴿子的男士。

sentences.english: The way to cure flaking is to demonstrate your value to a chick.
sentences.chinese: 醫治被放鴿子的辦法是向這個雛證明你的價值。

sentences.english: What could you have done differently to ensure that your prospect showed up to that appointment?
sentences.chinese: 這回你該怎麼做才能保證你不會再被放鴿子呢？

sentences.english: Today, I got stood up because my date decided it would be more fun to chase a tornado instead.
sentences.chinese: 今天我被放鴿子了，因爲男朋友想去追一隻龍捲風。

sentences.english: I stood her up last week. She properly did it to get even with me.
sentences.chinese: 上禮拜她被我放鴿子，所以她可能是在報復我。

sentences.english: Mary got stood up by the blind date.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗被約好跟她相親的人放鴿子了。

sentences.english: Susan stood me up last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我被蘇珊放鴿子了。

definition: to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities

(lit.) to wither in the light of day/(fig.) the bubble bursts as the reality becomes apparent (esp. of a much-anticipated first meeting with sb)/(of stocks) just as the favorable news is officially published, the stock price falls
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
lit. cuts and bruises all over (idiom); fig. totally refuted
